alert.note: Alert for Clark; Nevada; Ouachita (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 08 at 10:45AM CST until February 11 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Little Rock has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Arkansas... Little Missouri River Near Boughton affecting Clark, Ouachita and Nevada Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO SATURDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Little Missouri River Near Boughton. * WHEN...From this morning to Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Pastures along the river begin to flood. Water backing up half moon slough and boggy creek in Southwest Clark county. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 AM CST Wednesday the stage was 4.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 19.5 feet early Friday morning. - Action stage is 19.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 12 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Thu Fri Sat Crest Time Date Little Missouri Boughton 20.0 4.3 Wed 9 AM 17.9 18.0 12.9 19.5 12 AM 2/10 &&
info.instruction: If you are in the advisory area, remain alert to possible flooding or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
